intro: Loevigia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow and sometimes orange. These plants typically grow in moist, well-drained soils and are often found in woodland or streamside habitats. Loevigia species are perennial herbs that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. The genus is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America.
